segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of the message and transmit identifying number.
CTA, A segment to indicate the message sender's contact person/department.
COM, A segment to specify the telephone number of the message sender and other communication-related information.
FTX, A segment to give an explanation regarding the freight costs charged for in this message, credit facilities, letter of credit and arrangements made by the principal.
DTM, A segment to indicate date/times related to the message.
TSR, A segment to identify contract and carriage conditions and or services in the context of which all charges in this message apply.
DOC, A segment to indicate a document relating to the whole message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to indicate locations relevant to the IFTFCC message.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to indicate a location.
DTM, A segment to indicate the date of issue of the IFTFCC message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify references related to the IFTFCC message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference, e.g.: Sales contract reference number, Transport contract reference number (bill of lading, air waybill), Shipment reference number, Payee's reference number, Payer's reference number, Creditor's number, Debtor's number, Reference to the applicable General Conditions such as deposited at the Registry of the District Court.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify amounts resulting from the specification of the charges in this message.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the total amount payable.
PCD, A segment to indicate the applied reduction or surcharge percentage details as included in the total amount payable.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to calculate the tax amount for a specified tax type and percentage.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type, such as Value Added Tax (VAT).
PCD, A segment to indicate the applicable percentage for the tax type.
MOA, A segment to specify an amount associated to the tax.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify a default currency or a rate of exchange applicable to the whole message.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify a default currency or rate of exchange.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time relating to a rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify a charge and the charge calculation methodology, for example related to: - a transport service contract, or - a transport document or contract as referred to on message top level or in this group of segments - the set of voyages or conveyances or flights (in case of among others port charges) or the set of equipments or containers (in case of among others container lease contracts or terminal operations) or the set of consignments specified in the message over a certain period of time as mentioned on message top level. Full details relating to a specific charge can only be specified in this TCC segment group (i.e. in message top level). The charges as detailed in this segment group may be pointed to by one or more other TCC segments elsewhere in the message (i.e. one of the lower levels). When a TCC segment on one of the lower levels of this message is used as a pointer, then only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used, with a value that corresponds to the value of the same data element in a TCC segment on message top level.

segment.documentation: TCC, A segment to specify in text or code the applicable charge, such as trucking costs, haulage costs, sea freight, inland freight destination, issue of transport document, Currency Adjustment Factor (CAF), Bunker Adjustment Factor (BAF), terminal handling charge destination, commission, shed hiring, storage costs, lumpsum.

LOC, A segment to indicate a location related to the charge, such as: - 'from' location (starting point) - 'to' location (ending point) - 'on-hire' location (where hiring started) - 'off-hire' location (where hiring ended)

DTM, A segment to specify a date or time or period related to the charge, such as: - charged period - 'on-hire' period (i.e. period of hiring) - 'on-hire' date (when hiring started) - 'off-hire' date (when hiring ended)

RFF, A segment to identify a reference related to the charge, such as the reference number of the transport service contract, or of the transport document, or the applicable tariff number, or the applicable goods classification number.
FTX, A segment to specify an explanation regarding the charge.

PCD, A segment to indicate the applicable reduction or surcharge percentage details. This percentage is given here for information purposes and does not form part of a calculation applying to this charge. If a percentage forms a factor in a calculation the PCD segment within the MOA segment group should be used - i.e. the MOA-group within this TCC segment group.

QTY, A segment to specify a quantity relevant to calculate the charge, such as: - chargeable number of containers - changeable number of days - chargeable number of exles - chargeable number of packages.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify the price information of the charge. The amount resulting from the price calculation (i.e. quantity x price) is specified in the MOA segment following this PRI-group, either as an intermediate amount (i.e. with other calculations to follow; resulting amounts to be specified in a repeated MOA segment) or as a total charge amount in invoice currency.

segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to specify the price for the charge, such as the net price or the gross price (the gross price can be the value of the goods depending on the charge type rate as specified in the related TCC segment).
CUX, A segment to indicate the currency in which the price is expressed. An exchange rate can be specified in the CUX segment within the MOA segment group - i.e. the MOA-group within this TCC-group.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify an amount related to the charge. Only one of the segments or segment groups below the trigger segment MOA can be used. The amount resulting from the calculation within one occurrence of this MOA-group is placed in another occurrence of this MOA-group, which in turn may form the basis for an additional calculation.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify an amount related to a charge, such as: - intermediate amount (such as in a pre-defined sequence) - total charge amount in invoice currency.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to specify an exchange rate by which an amount can be re-calculated.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to indicate an exchange rate by which an amount can be re-calculated, such as: - from charge currency (i.e. currency in which the charge applies) into reference currency (i.e. currency in which freight is payable) - from reference currency into invoice currency (i.e. currency in which payment will take place).
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the exchange rate.
PCD, A segment to specify a percentage related to the amount, such as reduction or surcharge percentage applicable to the charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify tax-related information for the charge.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment to specify the tax type, such as Value Added Tax (VAT) related to the charge.
PCD, A segment to indicate the applicable percentage for the tax type.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A segment group to specify parties related to the IFTFCC message and their banking information.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify a party's name, address and function, such as message sender, message receiver, payee, payer, ordering party.
FII, A segment identifying the financial institution such as a bank and account numbers for the payee only.
LOC, A segment to indicate the place of registry (for payee).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments identifying a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to give references relevant to the party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number.
DTM, A segment to specify a date/time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to specify the terms of transport or delivery, applicable to this whole message.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment to specify the terms of transport or delivery.
LOC, A segment to specify a location relating to the terms given in the segment TOD.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments containing information as per original instruction on the charges that will be paid by the party charged in this message.

segment.documentation: CPI, A segment to indicate which method of payment is required.
CUX, A segment to specify the payment currency.
LOC, A segment to identify a place relevant to the charge category, such as the 'to' and 'from' locations such as border crossing places between which the charge category applies.
MOA, A segment to identify the monetary amount associated with the charges, such as the maximum amount that will be paid.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments specifying the payment terms applicable to the freight costs and/or other charges charged for in this IFTFCC message.

segment.documentation: PYT, A segment to identify the applicable payment terms.
DTM, A segment to specify the requested payment date and time, discount termination date and time, interest due date and time.
PCD, A segment to specify the discount, interest or penalty percentage.
MOA, A segment to specify an amount relating to the discount, interest or penalty.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments describing transport details or voyages or conveyances or flights to which the charges apply or which form a reference for the consignments or goods items charged for in the IFTFCC message.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to a certain stage in a transport.

TCC, A segment to point to a charge for which the full details are given in the TCC segment group on message top level. Only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used in this case.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and times relevant to the transport.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location relevant to the transport, such as: Place/port of loading Place/port of discharge Pre-carriage place/port On-carriage place/port

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments giving a reference to the transport details (such as voyage number) and or providing a cross-reference to a charge item (Segment group 6: TCC-group) on message top level.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify a reference to the transport details (such as voyage number) or a cross-reference.
DTM, A segment to specify a date or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: SG22-SG23 A group of segments describing goods item details for which the charge(s) applies. The charges can be detailed on message top level (TCC segment group).

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item for which transport is undertaken (such as total number of packages). A goods item can be identified by up to three levels of packaging.

TCC, A segment to point to a charge for which the full details are given in the TCC segment group on message top level. Only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used in this case.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item.
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for a goods item, such as movement type and carrier or merchant haulage.
LOC, A segment to specify a country associated with a goods item, such as country of origin, or country of destination.
PCI, A segment to specify shipping marks for this goods item.
PIA, A segment to specify article numbers.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information relating to the goods item, such as goods description (which may be in short with respect to the original instruction).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments to specify measurements applicable to a goods item.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to a goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments to specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.

segment.documentation: DIM, To specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units to each of which the given dimension applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments to identify references to a goods item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to indicate a reference to the goods item and or providing a cross- reference to the applicable charge item on the message level directly above (i.e. top message level).
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods, packing group, etc.
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name and to specify any additional dangerous goods information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments describing equipment details for which the charge(s) applies. The charges can be detailed on message top level (TCC segment group).

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to identify the equipment and equipment size and type as used in the transport, for example container number, railway wagon number or trailer number.

TCC, A segment to point to a charge for which the full details are given in the TCC segment group on message top level. Only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used in this case.
EQN, A segment to specify the total number of equipment.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for the equipment.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with the equipment, such as equipment weight.
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the equipment.
SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the equipment.
TPL, A segment to identify transport details for the equipment.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments giving a reference to the equipment details (such as contract number) and or providing a cross- reference to a charge item on the message level directly above.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify the reference by its number, such as lease contract number.
DTM, A segment to specify a date related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments to identify the equipment owner.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the equipment owner.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments to specify the attached equipment and related number of pieces.

segment.documentation: EQA, A segment to identify attached or related equipment such as a chassis attached to a container.
EQN, A segment to specify the applicable number of pieces of equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: SG34-SG35-SG37-SG42 A group of segments describing the different consignments for which the charges apply. The charges can be detailed on message top level (TCC segment group).

segment.documentation: CNI, A segment to identify a consignment in relation to a charge.

TCC, A segment to point to a charge for which the full details are given in the TCC segment group on message top level. Only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used in this case.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time applying to the consignment.
TSR, A segment to identify the contract, conditions of carriage, services, and priority requirements for the transport.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as consignment remarks or any other additional information.
MOA, A segment to specify an amount relating to this consignment, such as an amount resulting from the specification of the charges for this consignment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments to specify a default currency or exchange rate applicable to this consignment.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify a currency or rate of exchange for this consignment.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments to specify locations and related date(s)/time(s) which apply to the consignment, such as place of transhipment.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location relating to the consignment.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) relating to the location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 31: A group of segments giving a reference to the consignment specified and or providing a cross-reference to a charge item on message top level (segment group 6: TCC-group).

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify a reference which applies to the consignment (such as booking reference) and or a cross- reference to a charge item on message top level (segment group 6:TCC-group).
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 32: A group of segments to specify the terms of delivery or transport, applicable to this consignment.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment to specify the applicable terms of delivery or transport.
LOC, A segment to specify a location relating to the terms of delivery or transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 33: A group of segments to specify a payment instruction relating to this consignment.

segment.documentation: CPI, A segment to indicate the method of payment applying to this consignment.
CUX, A segment to specify the payment currency related to the charge methodology.
LOC, A segment to identify a place relevant to the charge category, such as the 'to' and 'from' locations such as border crossing places between which the charge category applies.
MOA, A segment to identify the monetary amount associated with the charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 34: A group of segments to specify transport details (such as voyage) related to this consignment.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to a certain stage in a transport.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the transport details, such as date and time of departure, date and time of arrival.
LOC, A segment to specify a location related to the transport details, such as place or port of departure, place or port of arrival.
RFF, A segment to specify a reference to the transport details and or providing a cross-reference to the applicable charge item on CNI-level (segment group 28).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 35: A group of segments to identify a party related to this consignment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address and function.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 36: A group of segments to provide contact information for the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within the party.
COM, A segment to specify a communication number for the person or department.
RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 37: SG40-SG41 A group of segments describing goods item details for which the charge(s) of this consignment applies. The charges of this consignment can be detailed on message top level (TCC segment group).

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item for which transport is undertaken (such as total number of packages). A goods item can be identified by up to three levels of packaging.

TCC, A segment to point to a charge for which the full details are given in the TCC segment group on message top level. Only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used in this case.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item.
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for a goods item, such as movement type and carrier or merchant haulage.
LOC, A segment to specify a country associated with a goods item, such as country of origin, or country of destination.
PCI, A segment to specify shipping marks for this goods item.
PIA, A segment to specify article numbers.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information relating to the goods item, such as goods description (which may be in short with respect to the original instruction).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 38: A group of segments to specify measurements applicable to a goods item.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to a goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 39: A group of segments to specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.

segment.documentation: DIM, To specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units to each of which the given dimension applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 40: A group of segments to identify references to a goods item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to indicate a reference to the goods item (such as order number) and or providing a cross- reference to the applicable charge item on the message level directly above (i.e., CNI-level).
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 41: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods, packing group, etc.
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name and to specify any additional dangerous goods information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 42: SG45 A group of segments describing equipment details for which the charge(s) of this consignment applies. The charges of this consignment can be specified on message top level (TCC segment group).

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to identify the equipment and equipment size and type as used in the transport, for example container number, railway wagon number or trailer number.

TCC, A segment to point to a charge for which the full details are given in the TCC segment group on message top level. Only the data element 'Freight and charges item number' (in composite C200) is to be used in this case.
EQN, A segment to specify the total number of equipment.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for the equipment.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with the equipment, such as equipment weight.
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the equipment.
SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the equipment.
TPL, A segment to identify transport details for the equipment.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 43: A group of segments giving a reference to the equipment details (such as contract number) and or providing a cross- reference to a charge item on the message level directly above (i.e., CNI-level).

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify the reference by its number, such as lease contract number.
DTM, A segment to specify a date related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 44: A group of segments to identify the equipment owner.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the equipment owner.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 45: A group of segments to specify the attached equipment and related number of pieces.

segment.documentation: EQA, A segment to identify attached or related equipment such as a chassis attached to a container.
EQN, A segment to specify the applicable number of pieces of equipment.
